ygData.msgSnippet: Far as I know the other maximals survived. He couldn t give her a deffinite answer. I don t know thier situation, I had to much to think about to worry

"Far as I know the other maximals survived." He couldn't give her a 
deffinite answer. "I don't know thier situation, I had to much to 
think about to worry about them."  He sensed her worry even without 
telepathic powers. "Veratis needs us right now, we can't worry about 
the Maximals at the moment." We owe him your life and my body. Until 
we settle the score I'm staying here."

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> Ice::
> 
> She stepped back from him. "The ark is gone? How?"
> 
> She looked at him, slightly shocked by his words. "And the other 
> maximals? Did they survive? Do they need our help? Will we be going 
> to help them?"
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
> > Lunarpine wanted to keep the hapiness going but knew that he 
> couldn't 
> > keep it to himself much longer. "I hate to change the subject but 
> > I've got bad news for you. The Arks been destroyed. I lost 
contact 
> > with it when I was chaseing down an infiltrator." he loosened his 
> > grip, looked her in the eye "And Strikers dead. He was killed by 
a 
> > creature calling himself Slayer." He wasn't telling the whole 
truth 
> > but it was enough of the truth for her to know. "I was sporting 
the 
> > marks of a battle with him when I returned." He kept his mind 
> focused 
> > on her eyes so she wouldn't be able to read past that.
> > 
> > Foxfingers heard her in his mind again. "HMMPH" He muttered as he 
> > left. He couldn't tell if she was in his head or not. He just 
> wanted 
> > her out.
> >
